definition: to call out to/to greet/to say hello to/to inform/to take care of/to take care that one does not
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out
to greet sb by word or action/to give prior notice

sentences.english: A girl in Yao minority dress warmly greeting customers.
sentences.chinese: 穿着民族服装的瑶家姑娘，热情地招呼来往市民。

sentences.english: I delightedly hugged and greeted my grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 我愉快地拥抱了我的孙子孙女，和他们打招呼。

sentences.english: Greeting with Iranian, you need to address their surname with their academic or job title.
sentences.chinese: 和伊朗人打招呼，要称他们的姓加上学术或职务头衔。

sentences.english: That evening when she entered the theatre the manager had a most pleasant greeting for her.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，当她走进戏院时，经理极其和悦地招呼她。

sentences.english: Simba come down and greets his mother and Nala…
sentences.chinese: 辛巴走下来身他的母亲和娜拉打招呼。

sentences.english: Will you say hello to your neighbor?
sentences.chinese: 你会主动和新邻居打招呼吗？

sentences.english: If you need any hogs rounded up, call me.
sentences.chinese: 只要有人需要把猪赶回圈里，招呼我一声就是了。

sentences.english: "C'mon baby, " said Naci, beckoning me to follow.
sentences.chinese: “跟我来吧，孩子，”纳希说，招呼我跟他走。

sentences.english: and you say "hi" to everyone that you see on the street.
sentences.chinese: 无论在街上遇到谁，你都可以跟他打招呼。

sentences.english: She passed me in the street without saying hello.
sentences.chinese: 她在街上与我擦肩而过，却连一声招呼也没打。

sentences.english: In Kenya the Massai people usually greet each other by spitting on his or her body.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亚马塞族人用往对方身上吐口水的方式打招呼。

sentences.english: Have so an inn, counterjumper very calm ground accost I come in sit.
sentences.chinese: 有这么一家店，店员很坦然地招呼我进来坐。

sentences.english: He went by his teacher without even a greeting.
sentences.chinese: 他从老师身边经过时连声招呼也没打。

sentences.english: She greets her husband's friends creamily.
sentences.chinese: 殷勤地招呼丈夫的朋友。

sentences.english: He waited, expecting that she would call out to him to bring it in to her.
sentences.chinese: 他等在那里，以为她会招呼他把苇子给她拿进屋去。

sentences.english: She looked me straight through when I greeted her.
sentences.chinese: 我跟她打招呼时她故意不理睬我。

definition: to greet sb by word or action/to give prior notice
to say hello to/to send one's regards to
to exchange conventional greetings/to exchange pleasantries
to exchange conventional greetings/to talk about the weather
to talk/to get into conversation with/to send word
to get up/to leave/to set forth
